name: Hotel Riu Palace Cabo San Lucas

reviews.title: The Riu Palace was outstanding!!!!!!
reviews.text: I just returned from our trip to the Riu where my son had his wedding. We were there from 2/22 - 2/26/06

reviews.title: will return to the rui
reviews.text: After reading some reviews here before we went, I have to admit that I was a little bit worried. I had read that the food was terrible, the help wasn't friendly and that the pools were not clean.

reviews.title: YOU HAVE TO READ THIS!!!
reviews.text: Nothing could be further from the truth! I found the staff to be very helpful and the pools were clean and not at all crowded. The bartender at the pool bar (Marco) was wonderful! I didn't eat a lot of the food because I am a fussy eater and I need to know what I am eating before I eat it. The buffet tables weren't always labelled. The rest of the people I was with (about 23 others) said the food was pretty good with the exception of the beef being a little overcooked at times.

reviews.title: Like a Cruise Ship on Land! Very nice.
reviews.text: The wedding ceremony was at the gazebo overlooking the beach and it was a beautiful ceremony. We had the reception in a little courtyard outside one of the restaurants and it was simply wonderful.

reviews.title: Like a mediocre cruise on the beach
reviews.text: I had heard that the beds were a little bit hard and I guess they were but I slept well each night which is unusual for me when I am away from home. The rooms were clean and the bar and refrigerator was replenished daily. We were also very free with the tips which is always a good idea when you travel.

reviews.title: Accessible and family friendly.
reviews.text: Our stay was great! Feb. 11-18, 2006. Very relaxing for a family of three that were in need of complete relaxation and enjoyment. My husband is confinded to a wheelchair and was able to get around well. The ramp from the main level to the pool was steep but with assistance he did fine. Our son was over joyed with the Mini Club. He really enjoyed the daily activities and the nightly movie. Our day's consisted of lounging at the pool and soaking up all the warm sun we could. As a family we adventured into town and did a little shopping. My son and I went on a glass bottom boat ride to Lover's Beach and got to see the sea lions. I enjoyed the parasailing with a friend I met. My husband enjoyed the peace of no business calls, meeting new people and sun bathing.

The food we would classify as average because we owned a restaurant and expected more flavor and quality. But in the hotels defense we understand that they serve a large mass of people a day and know pleasing everyone is not possible. We loved the San Jose lunch but not their dinner meal. The breakfast buffet was excellent and our son enjoyed the pizza from all the restaurants. We wish they would have more of an American food selections, especially for kids, such as chicken finger, mac and cheese, vegetable soup, cookies, more cooked vegetables such as corn, green beans, sweet potatoes etc. The beds were very hard. The staff was very good. The drinks were good, it was hard to get use to the soda's because they have less carbonation than the US. We were pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel and our room. I don't understand how some people could have disliked this beautiful hotel. People with high standards need to live life in Mexico more freely. This is a great hotel and we well be back!
reviews.title: Loved It!
Just okay
reviews.text: I've read some of the reviews by people that stayed the same week (Feb 11th - 18th) as my wife and I, and honestly I don't understand what they expect from Mexico. My wife and I are well travelled through the carribean and europe and you have to expect some level of free enterprise by the Mexicans. Try walking down the street in Barcelona or Lisbon and you'll think Cabo San Lucas is Conneticut.

Hotel: The hotel is beautiful. It's relatively new, clean, and located 15mins by bus from town. We took the bus a couple time and had no problems. The service at the hotel was the best I've experienced in Mexico. We had management approach us twice during our stay to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. While at the hotel, I was never approached for a time share, this is amazing for Mexico. Our departure flight was running late and the hotel let us stay longer and have lunch and drinks. Most all-inclusives send you to the airport and make you wait there so you're not consuming their drinks and food. This was greatly appreciated!
reviews.title: Great Place Ignore the Negative Reviews from the Negative People
LOVED THE RIU
reviews.text: Room: Our room was very clean and the stocked fridge with beer and water was great. The housekeeping staff are pleasant and will do anything you ask of them. The beds are a bit hard but not a big issue.

We've been back a week from our wonderful vacation at the Riu (2/19 - 2/25/06) and we want to be back there! The property and resort are beautiful --- well-kept, pristine, with something for everyone. I would give it a huge thumbs up - but if you're going, here are a couple of things to keep in mind:
reviews.title: Wonderful time at the Riu!

reviews.text: - They say to stay away from the timeshare people at the airport -- but sometimes you can't tell who the timeshare people are until it's too late! We asked for American Express Transportation (pre-booked by our travel agent) and were directed to a desk where a woman asked where we were staying, said the van would be by in 5 minutes and in the meantime "presented" us with all kinds of tourist propaganda. I'm embarassed to say we got sucked in! Once we figured out we were being worked, we quickly found someone else to get us to the Am Ex transportation area. So, beware - don't approach any desk in the airport unless you see they are wearing signs for the transportation company you need.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Riu

reviews.text: -- The hotel is gorgeous - and huge! We booked 2 ocean view suites (connecting) as we were traveling with our teenagers. The connecting rooms are all downstairs and our ocean view was actually out the side of the hotel. I was ready to change them, but it actually worked out better --- we still had a view of the ocean, but we weren't right on the pool or over the walkways where it can get noisy at night or early a.m. Our rooms looked out toward the city of Cabo San Lucas, too which was fun - we watched the sun sets etc.
reviews.title: Read This! Short Honest Review

reviews.text: -- The firm beds are great if you add the pad on top. My husband and I had requested a king size bed, but all connecting rooms have 2 doubles. Within minutes, housekeeping came, pushed our beds together and put a pad on it - no seam; big, comfy bed! The connecting rooms have a shared hallway too which was nice because it enabled us a little more privacy.
reviews.title: Sorry to leave

reviews.text: -- The food at the buffets is always plentiful, with something for everyone. Unless you are a chardonnay drinker (they offer a lighter white wine with dinners). We ate at the Japanese restaurant one night and although it was good, my family liked being able to pick and choose from the buffet foods. Breakfast is especially good -- if you can sit outside it's even better.
reviews.title: Something for everyone

reviews.text: We recently stayed for a week at the Riu Palace as part of medium sized optometric conference. The complex is architechturially beautiful, but had many shortcomings that we did not expect based on past stays at Riu Palaces.
reviews.title: nice complex, but many shortcomings
Riu Palace in Cabo, service (-)
reviews.text: The lobby and common areas were beautiful. The rooms are nicely appointed, but somewhat small for a hotel of this calibre. Our so-called junior suite was nothing but what I would call an ordinary hotel room. The description is very misleading.

reviews.title: Fantastic place!
reviews.text: The pool area is beautiful, with plenty of cots around the pool and very good service from staff looking to take drink orders. One big disappointment. The water in the pool was far too cold, making swimming the pool for any length of time far from enjoyable. Lazing around in the pool, as you might expect on a tropical holiday, was not particularly enticing.

The beach in front of the hotel was also a big disappointment. While it looked very nice, the shoreline and strong current made it all but impossible for normal ocean swimming. No sailboats were available, apparently for the very same reason. Interestingly enough, they were able to get jetskis in and out without too much problem, likely due to the amount of money they could make renting these items. Most fancy all-inclusives have a variety of non-motorized watersports available in the price. The lack of these at this hotel was a big disappointment
reviews.title: Riu Palace Sucks
Nice Hotel Here are some Tips
reviews.text: The sand, while very pretty, was not nice. Beach volleyball was literally a pain, as the sand was as coarse as cut glass. Walking up and down the beach was also not very enjoyable, as the texture of the sand and the dramatic slope by the water also made walking a major effort.

aka: Riu Palace Cabo San Lucas Hotel Cabo San Lucas
description: Located in the southern Baja California peninsula, 4.5 km/2.8 miles from Cabo San Lucas. 5-storey building. On the beachfront. Complimentary sun loungers on the beach. 32,000 m2 garden. 3.5 km/2.2 miles from downtown Cabo San Lucas. 40 km/25 miles from the airport. 500 m/1650 ft from a bus stop. Credit cards accepted: MasterCard, Amex, Visa, Diners.
